result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kemuel S Perez-Lopez

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Victim Restitution Form -- NS
Received and Filed. Victim Impact Statement -- NS

Defendant Kemuel S Perez-Lopez appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Kemuel S Perez-Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has offer and discovery and requests adjourned pretrial conference.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kemuel S Perez-Lopez in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Kemuel S Perez-Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with Jaymiah G.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kemuel S Perez-Lopez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway appeared by video for Kemuel S Perez-Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
